column4: These are ppa's, so they can be installed the way you'd do something with synaptic?
they're debs, it should work fine
sacarlson: Very good :D I thought there was something like that since the kernel upgrades always come through debs
pretty much first result on google ;)
sacarlson: I'm to install the header and the image that both fir my architecture, correct?
Hah, here I was already looking up compiling howto's :/
I'm not sure youy need the headers if not compiling thou
Probably won't be compiling any custom drivers, but I'll go ahead and get the headers anyway. May as well.
if you check http://kernel.ubuntu.com/~kernel-ppa/mainline/ there are a bunch of other kernels that may or may not be more up-to-date but still 2.6.32
While I'm here, I was going to boot back into gnome, but does anybody know a Software Center alternative for Fluxbox?
One more thing. My architecture is apparently i686. I assume that I can also use the i386 deb, but is it that one or the "all" I should be getting?
i386 and i686 us pretty much interchangeable
